definitions.definition: the quality of being expressed clearly

examples.text: a lack of clarity in the law
The brilliant clarity of his argument could not be faulted.
She expressed herself with great clarity.
There's still no clarity about what sort of programme it's going to be.

definitions.definition: the ability to think about or understand something clearly

examples.text: With painful clarity she remembered the day he had died.

definitions.definition: if a picture, substance or sound has clarity, you can see or hear it very clearly, or see through it easily

examples.text: the clarity of the sound on the recording

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘glory, divine splendour’): from Latin claritas, from clarus ‘clear’. The current sense dates from the early 17th cent.
